intro: Sphenomeris yaeyamensis, commonly known as the Yaeyama sphenomeris, is a rare flowering plant native to the Yaeyama Islands in Japan. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous regions with high humidity. Its leaves are elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
